html:
PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 2020-07972020-10-07,  ,  HC,  PHAC,  , 
ActQuarantine Act
SubjectMinimizing the Risk of Exposure to COVID-19 in Canada Order (Mandatory Isolation), No. 6
PrecisMINIMIZING THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO COVID-19 IN CANADA ORDER (MANDATORY ISOLATION), NO. 6 in order to (1) support Canada’s continued focus on reducing the introduction and further spread of COVID-19 by decreasing the risk of importing cases from outside the country; (2) continue applying stringent measures to reduce the spread by persons who have reasonable grounds to suspect they have COVID-19, if they have signs and symptoms of COVID-19, or if they know they have COVID-19 on arrival at the border; (3) permit asymptomatic entrants to temporarily leave quarantine on compassionate grounds; (4) clarify that existing exemptions granted by the Chief Public Health Officer (CPHO) apply only if the person complied with any condition imposed on them by the CPHO; (5) replace the use of “minor” with “dependent child”; and (6) make grammatical changes for clarity.
AttachmentsAttachment
subject: Minimizing the Risk of Exposure to COVID-19 in Canada Order (Mandatory Isolation), No. 6
precis: MINIMIZING THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO COVID-19 IN CANADA ORDER (MANDATORY ISOLATION), NO. 6  in order to (1) support Canada’s continued focus on reducing the introduction and further spread of COVID-19 by decreasing the risk of importing cases from outside the country; (2) continue applying stringent measures to reduce the spread by persons who have reasonable grounds to suspect they have COVID-19, if they have signs and symptoms of COVID-19, or if they know they have COVID-19 on arrival at the border; (3) permit asymptomatic entrants to temporarily leave quarantine on compassionate grounds; (4) clarify that existing exemptions granted by the Chief Public Health Officer (CPHO) apply only if the person complied with any condition imposed on them by the CPHO; (5) replace the use of “minor” with “dependent child”; and (6) make grammatical changes for clarity.
